answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Unexplained aches and pains coming on and off could be due to fibromyalgia, chronic fatigue syndrome, rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, Crohn’s disease, H pylori infection, anemia, liver disorders, diabetes, hypothyroidism, Vit B12 or Vit D deficiency and due to calcium or magnesium deficiency. It can also be due to sleep related disorders.Since I cannot examine you and know other related conditions you may be having, nor is a detailed history possible on net, I have listed the various possibilities that should be looked into. Please consult your PCP to run tests and examination to clinch a diagnosis. Take care!

question: I started to feel a difference in my body about 6 months ago when I was in a taxi with a bunch of people and started to develop tightness in my entire chest and underarms..I got out of taxi and had difficult breathing. AFter relaxing for awhile it eventually calmed down.  It flaired up a few time a couple months after and I felt similiar pains.  Now over the last 3-4 months I have pain everyday in my chest muscles closer to my armits..Sometimes the pain is also in  my abdomin as well.  The pain is hard to explain but it a sharp consistant pain.  It feels better when I put my arms a sort of way.  The pain also intensifies when I am driving in my car with a passanger next to me.  It sounds weird but everytime I am next to some one whether be in a car or sittng at a table eating the pain is bad.  I have trouble breathing when this pain occurs.  Alot of times the pain is so bad that i need to walk around to make it feel better.  When i get the blood flowing, walk around go to gym and fast walk on tred mill the pain is subdued.  Also when my body is numb by liquor the pain is fine.  I dont want to drink alcohol everyday but it definetly helps me feel much better.  I had a bi lateral ultrasound done of my legs to check for clots, which was fine.  Also took a chest xray which was fine aswell.  Took 2 blood samples which were fine  also checked diabetes and nothing.  Did an oxygen check on blood and fine as well.  Started taking anti inflammatory medicine.  tried cepro first but little affects and now i am taking somthing else cant recall name.  It helped the first 2 weeks but not as much anymore..Doctor things i may have Fibromyalgia but not sure have to go back again next week.  Its been months now and no conclusion just pain to deal with.  I dont feel myself anymore and its extemly difficult to drive when someone is in my passanger seat.  I cant even go in someone elses car cause the pain is unbarable i feel like im going to burst somtimes...When i cross my arms and press down on my body it seems to help ease the pain, but I dont want to continue to poke or pressure my body.. Any advise???
title: Pains affecting my body
